intro: Cymopterus glomeratus var. glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and lance-shaped. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
